creator: rowley@musicstrands.com
text:
When using ExternallyRolledFileAppender, Multiple calls to
PropertyConfigurator.configure will result in an endless slough of JVM.Bind
error messages.  These messages will fill up their eventual endpoint incredibly
fast.

It would be great if the configurator or the HUP class in
ExternallyRolledFileAppender would quit attempting to bind after a certain
number of failures.  Also, an error message needs to be sent to the log4j.debug
log when this case is encountered.

creator: rowley@musicstrands.com
text:
Note that you'll need to have the port configured to a non-zero value to see the
issue in action.

creator: carnold@apache.org
text:
I was just thinking about this class.  In the log4j 1.3 development, the previous rolling file appenders 
had been removed in favor of a new generic RFA framework (in org.apache.log4j.rolling).  Unfortunately 
this left users of the former RollingFileAppender and DailyRollingFileAppender without a migration 
path.  To address that I added emulations of RFA and DRFA that wrap the new framework.  I was 
unaware of ExternallyRolledFileAppender at that time.  The CVS log for the removal of ERFA says it was 
an "unused" class but since there are several bug reports on ERFA, I can't see how it can be claimed as 
unused.

I hope to add an emulation similar to those added for the other log4j 1.2 xRFA's and make a stab at 
addressing the bugs.  If you are able to provide feedback on that work, that would be appreciated.  I've 
also just posted a thread suggesting a new minor release branch, that may be able to incorporate any 
fixes from the 1.3 line, however the 1.2 line has been closed to anything less than a critical bug. 

May be same bug as 30407

Thanks for the quick response!  The wrapper class in the 1.3 release would be
much appreciated.
creator: rowley@musicstrands.com
carnold@apache.org
text:
Wrapper class now in CVS HEAD for 1.3.  Reworked to retry on bind failures which occur on respository 
reset.  Added test case in unit tests, but not in Gump tests since network IO may be restricted.  To run 
unit tests:

cd tests
ant ExternallyRolled

Would appreciate feedback.
